title: Trump calls for the termination of the US Constitution in Truth Social post
description: Former President Donald Trump called for the termination of the Constitution to overturn the 2020 election and reinstate him to power Saturday in a continuation of his election denialism and pushing of fringe conspiracy theories.

title: 'Wrong, crazy and dangerous': Legal analyst blasts Trump's statement
description: CNN senior legal analyst and former federal prosecutor Elie Honig reacts to former President Donald Trump's statement on his social media platform Truth Social.

title: Cruise ship passenger who fell overboard recounts harrowing experience
description: When James Michael Grimes fell overboard from a Carnival cruise ship in the Gulf of Mexico, he said the sheer will to live, along with strength from God, kept him alive as he miraculously swam for what he believes was more than 15 hours.

title: Wealthy Russian businessman arrested in London on suspicion of multiple offenses, including money laundering
description: A wealthy Russian businessman has been arrested as part of a "major operation" on suspicion of multiple offenses, the United Kingdom's National Crime Agency said in a statement Saturday.

title: Lionel Messi scores in 1000th career game as Argentina reaches World Cup quarterfinals
description: Lionel Messi scored in what was the 1,000th game of his storied career as Argentina beat Australia 2-1 to advance to the World Cup quarterfinals.

title: Argentina is facing Australia
Argentina vs Australia kicks off
What to expect from Argentina vs. Australia
How Jiang Zemin's death could impact protests in China
description: Jiang Zemin, the Chinese communist leader who paved the way for the country's emergence as a global superpower, has died, state-run Xinhua news agency announced. CNN's Ivan Watson reports on the impact the former president's death could have on the ongoing protests against China's "zero-Covid" policy.

title: Putin will visit parts of Ukraine that he proclaimed as annexed 'in due course,' spokesperson says
It's a tough exit for America's so-called Golden Generation
description: The United States Men's National Team (USMNT) was defeated 3-1 by the Netherlands and knocked out the World Cup in the round of 16, despite a spirited performance.

title: Group suspected of trying to steal Banksy mural in Ukraine arrested
description: Authorities in Ukraine have detained a group of people who allegedly tried to steal a mural by renowned graffiti artist Banksy from the wall of a building that was damaged by Russian shelling.

title: It's crunch time for team USA as the Netherlands lead 2-0
See photos from the Apollo era like never before
description: Selfies weren't a common practice when humanity first reached the moon.

title: Football world wishes Pelé well as the Brazilian star remains in hospital
description: Past and present football stars have been wishing Pelé well on social media after local media reports in Brazil that his health had worsened.

title: 6.1-magnitude earthquake strikes Indonesian island of Java
description: An earthquake of 6.1 magnitude hit Indonesia's West Java province on Saturday, the country's geophysics agency BMKG said.

title: The US trails the Netherlands in a do-or-die match that determines who will advance to the quarterfinals
Putin will visit parts of Ukraine that he proclaimed as annexed 'in due course,' Kremlin says
description:
• Russia's war changed the lives of many trans people
• Letters with explosives and animal parts are aimed at 'sowing fear': Ukrainian official

title: Kate wears Princess Diana emerald choker to Earthshot Prize Awards
description: Catherine, Princess of Wales delighted at the 2022 Earthshot Prize awards Friday evening, showcasing her sustainable style in a rented gown and accessorizing with an emerald choker once famously worn by her late mother-in-law, Diana.

title: Lawmakers brawl, throw chairs after male MP slaps female politician
description: A brawl broke out in Senegal's parliament as lawmakers butted heads over Senegalese President Macky Sall potentially seeking a third term.

title: Why 2022 is the year of the espresso martini
description: It might be 2022, but people are still ordering espresso martinis like it's the 90s.

title: Forget smartwatches, consumers are snapping up these quirky alternatives
description: In 2015, the same year Apple introduced its smartwatch, a Kickstarter campaign launched for a very different kind of wearable device: a wellness-tracking ring called the Oura.

title: Broadway actor Quentin Oliver Lee dies of cancer at 34
description: Broadway actor Quentin Oliver Lee has died at age 34, according to an online announcement from his wife. The post comes six months after Lee said he was diagnosed with stage 4 colon cancer.

title: Catfish scams target everyone. Here's how to keep kids safe
description: Catfishing crimes have ensnared people for years.

title: Rhode Island's $10 million spend in reparations could benefit White residents
description: Officials in Providence, Rhode Island, recently approved a $10 million budget plan for the city's reparations program, but some are wondering who might end up benefiting from it.

title: This could be the largest floating structure ever built
description: Unleash the elves, December is here. Start the holiday countdown with our roundup of 15 luxury hotels that go all out for Christmas and then read about Advent traditions around the world.

title: LeBron James passes Magic Johnson on NBA's career assists list
description: LeBron James moved past Magic Johnson for sixth place on the NBA's all-time assists list as the Los Angeles Lakers took a hard earned 133-129 win over the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Christmas vacations: 15 of the best places to go for holiday spirit
description: Anyplace can string up a few lights and call it a holiday celebration, but travelers who really love Christmas want more.

title: Astronauts will give the space station a power boost during Saturday spacewalk
description: The International Space Station will receive a power boost during a spacewalk on Saturday, as NASA astronauts Josh Cassada and Frank Rubio install a solar array outside the floating laboratory.

title: How a deadly fire ignited dissent over China's zero-Covid policy
description: Stunning scenes of dissent and defiance played out across China over the past week, marking the country's largest protests in decades -- and an unprecedented challenge to leader Xi Jinping.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo denies he swore at Portugal coach over substitution
description: Cristiano Ronaldo denied that he had sworn at Portugal coach Fernando Santos when he was substituted during a dramatic 2-1 defeat to South Korea in the World Cup on Friday, as both teams advanced into the next round.

title: Jonathan the tortoise, world's oldest land animal, celebrates his 190th birthday
description: The South Atlantic island of St. Helena is celebrating the birthday of the world's oldest living land animal -- a Seychelles giant tortoise called Jonathan, who is turning 190.

title: 'Rogue wave' kills American woman, injures four on Antarctic cruise
description: One passenger was killed and four injured when a "rogue wave" hit their cruise ship  during a storm earlier this week.

title: 'I wanted to resume my transition at all costs.' Trans Ukrainians uprooted by war struggle to continue treatment
description: The best day of Eric's life came just days before the worst.

title: 'A remarkable storyteller': Remembering Gary Strieker, who helped establish CNN's presence in Africa
description: Gary Strieker had every reason to be a pessimist. People dying of hunger, brutal killings and many other horrific events that he covered as an international reporter unfolded right before his eyes.

title: Qatari TV pundits mock Germany's 'OneLove' armband protest after World Cup exit
description: Football pundits on Qatar's Alkass Sports channel mocked the German football team following its World Cup exit -- by mimicking the players' protest over human rights.

title: Royal US trip overshadowed but Prince William still manages to get his message out
description: This week's newsletter is coming out a little later than normal -- but for a good reason. We wanted to bring readers along to the grand finale of the Prince and Princess of Wales' US visit -- the Earthshot Prize Award ceremony.

title: How a deadly fire ignited dissent over China's zero-Covid policy
description: Stunning scenes of dissent and defiance played out across China over the past week, marking the country's largest protests in decades -- and an unprecedented challenge to leader Xi Jinping.

title: Sydney opens 'most significant' arts venue since Opera House
description: In a World War II-era fuel storage tank deep beneath Sydney, the smell of gasoline still hangs in the air. Pulsing lights sweep the cavernous space to reveal fragments of "The End of Imagination," an installation by Argentine artist Adrián Villar Rojas. Five twisting sculptural forms, born from a digitized future of Rojas' creation, emerge out of the darkness.

title: 'I was in complete shock': Illinois eighth grader makes wild game-winning basketball shot
description: An Illinois eighth grader describes making a nearly full-court shot with just three seconds left in his basketball game against a rival team.

title: Lionel Messi and Argentina face Australia in next step towards World Cup glory
description: The World Cup has hardly been straightforward for Lionel Messi and Argentina thus far, but they are strong favorites ahead of their round of 16 game against Australia.
